# PKCanvasViewDelegate

**Protocol**

Methods for monitoring drawing related changes in a canvas view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor protocol PKCanvasViewDelegate : UIScrollViewDelegate
```

## Overview

Implement the methods of the [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKCanvasViewDelegate] protocol to monitor drawing events in a [doc://com.apple.pencilkit/documentation/PencilKit/PKCanvasView] object. Specifically, determine the start- and end-of-event sequences using the currently selected tool, and determine when those events affect the drawn content.

## Responding to drawing-related changes

- **canvasViewDrawingDidChange(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the contents of the current drawing changed.
- **canvasViewDidFinishRendering(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the previously drawn content is ready to display.

## Responding to new event sequences

- **canvasViewDidBeginUsingTool(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the user started a new drawing sequence with the currently selected tool.
- **canvasViewDidEndUsingTool(_:)**: Tells the delegate that the user ended a drawing sequence with the tool they were using.

## Responding to drawing-related changes

- **delegate**: The object you use to respond to changes in the drawn content or with the selected tool.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol
- UIScrollViewDelegate
